metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5773 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
php_zip.c in the zip extension in PHP before 5.5.37, 5.6.x before 5.6.23, and 7.x before 7.0.8 improperly interacts with the unserialize implementation and garbage collection, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (use-after-free and application crash) via crafted serialized data containing a ZipArchive object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5773` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Applications should never deserialize unauthenticated data. precise needs backported fix we will not be fixing this in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. We recommend validating untrusted data before unserializing.

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.19').
